I

illegalMove(Checker, Checker[], String[][], String) - Method in class Checker
Checks if current move is legal and returns false if it is illegal if the piece is a king, allow backwards and forwards movement if a chain of moves is possible, take all moves in the chain if the square is empty, and not white, allow movement by returning true
illegalMove(Checker, Checker[], String[][], String) - Method in interface CheckerInterface
This function checks if a move is legal.
illegalPlacement(Checker, Checker[], String[][]) - Method in class Checker
sets the white tiles' coordinates to 'null' so that no pieces can be placed on them if the user attempts to place a piece on a null tile or a tile with a piece already in that tile, the method returns true so that the piece cannot be placed
illegalPlacement(Checker, Checker[], String[][]) - Method in interface CheckerInterface
Checks current checker with other checkers locations to see if current checker is overlapping

isKing() - Method in class Checker
returns whether or not the piece is a king
isKing() - Method in interface CheckerInterface
checks if the piece is a king or not
isKing() - Method in class Node
Checks if king
isSelected(String, Checker[]) - Method in class Checker
checks if the tile selected has the selected checker on it
isSelected(String, Checker[]) - Method in interface CheckerInterface
Checks if there is a checker piece on the currently selected tile.
isYellow - Variable in class MainGUI
Checks if Yellow piece has been selected
